title: Assassin update actually fulfills the assassin fantasy, the other updates were merely for gameplay..
body:
Assassins are now going to be like the coolest class in the game?

Not saying anything balanced based, they are fine balance wise. But what kind of epic feeling and gameplay are Juggernauts, Tanks, ADCs, Supports, etc going to have in comparison to all this epic parkour stuff, intricate blinking finesse and crud? I mean, most Juggernauts don't even feel 'powerful' in exchange, most tanks don't feel like a 'steel wall', most marksman don't really feel like high skilled, finesse filled ranged fighters or blasting cannons in the way they should.

Perhaps this can be fixed merely with visual and sound updates. But to me, it feels like most of the reworked assassins will really be living up to their fantasy now. While other class/champion updates have been okay... but mostly were just some mild gameplay updates and balance. They didn't really make their fantasy feel more epic and impactful like with the assassin update.

Like, we need Juggernauts to actually feel like somebody who is coming to march up to you in an intimidating manner and wipe the floor with foes through mighty blows.

We need tanks to feel like they are going to crash into you and tie you all down.

Ashe needs to feel like fucking ice Legolas! Not a slow moving machine gun with a stun who serves the role of DPS for her team.

Only some of these champions feel kinda like this. While the assassins, especially Kat and Talon, are amazing now.

All the other updates? They feel like they were done merely for balance and gameplay sake. Very few of them really expanded on champion fantasies.

Let's hope they care enough. They aren't assassins after all.

You can just FEEL the power in sion. Literally every time I hold up my Q and snap it early to catch an enemy, I feel the power in my finger as I release the Q key. It feels so good.

When Graves pumps 8 crit shots to your face you feel the burst of a shotgun weilding champ.

Yea, the assassin update is a bit more fleshed out, but it's all a matter of opinion.

Maybe it's just because they're my type of champion, but I feel like most of the Juggernauts deliver their fantasy fairly well.

Especially {{champion:122}}. The feeling of raw power you have with 5 stacks is insane.
I main {{champion:102}} and also play some {{champion:77}} as well as {{champion:86}}. I feel Juggernauts just don't live up to the power fantasy properly.
{{champion:86}} fufills it well imo when he lands that ult.  It's just...justified.
that shockwave...
Well, Brand feels a bit better after MYMU. But Zyra and Malzahar. Oh god, they are just boring.

Darius is definitely a good juggernaut rework, it's just that the other 3 fell flat and the other Juggernauts outside the rework (Trundle, bear, Shyv) only auto attack and not much else 

But chaining dunks, wew that's fun
{{champion:201}} i want this guy to have a skill called lovepunch

Yeah.
Mages don't feel like powerful users of mystical arts that control the battlefield or world through their skill, knowledge, or raw power. Only like... Brand, who feels pretty much like a fire mage.

Marksman don't really feel like skilled marksman, archers, snipers, they feel like ranged, squishy damage sticks.

I actually feel like the old skarner felt more juggernaut than the new one xD

It really does feel like assassins got an update with the class fantasy in mind, whereas the others just kinda got changed.
on that note, i think jhin and jinx(minus her traps) hit the mark on what marksmen should feel like
